page.title: 19Mousehole Harbour (1)
page.content: The{Harbour at Mousehole}is a private harbour and has its own {Harbour Commissioners}who are responsible for the upkeep of the harbour and its surrounds. The north quay is the oldest and was built in three sections. The oldest part of which may have been built by the{Phoenicians}as a breakwater to protect the punts collecting fresh water for their larger boats. This was extended soon after 1389 and then further seawards again in the early{18th. century. The south quay (or new quay) was built in the late{19th. century}using some of the stones that had been used for the previous south quay built earlier in that century. The large wooden baulks of timber to be seen on the south quay are lowered into slots to seal the harbour mouth in winter.
